content.description: Climb corner to flake.
Not sure yet ???
Start on 7 slates of gray.   At 3rd bolt move left to flake/crack. trad to a lone bolt at top of flake.   easy 5th class up to 7 slates anchors.
content.protection: draws/gear to 2".   or, TR from 7 slates

content.description: Part 1:   Climb steep-ish slab with large hands and a few nice stances to a large ledge with anchors (5.6 40').   Part 2:   Hard moves to get established on the wall.   Continue beyond first anchors on ever steeper slab/face. Holds exist to the left of the first anchor (thin) to a bulge. Move over the bulge going slightly left and then back right.  The goal being the 4th bolt because better holds after that to top (5.10 40 more feet).
content.protection: 13 or 14 bolts and 2 bolt anchor.   Stopping at the second anchor is recommended. There is a 3rd slightly higher anchor but is really chossy.

content.description: Just right of chimney start climbing on thin steep slab. body tension and position help up high. At 30 feet pull left over roof (crux) with powerful mantle and continue to anchors.
content.location: Same start as chimney. Or, climb chimney of horror. At top walk right along ledge from chimney anchors to these anchors and TR.

content.description: Begin on the front face below the first bolt. Balancey lie back up corner and then flakes. Move slightly right and follow thin seam with pods to large hold. Far right is chossy. Move back left on jugs and pull on to low angle slab to anchors.
content.protection:
8 bolts plus 2 bolt anchor.

 SAFETY NOTICE: The bolts are very close at the start of this route. You may feel like you don't need to clip them all. CLIP THEM ALL. Many of these bolts are not for the leader, but to direct the rope away from a razor sharp flake that WILL cut your rope.

 When TRing have the leader remove the last (8th) draw and move the rope to the right. It's easier on the rope if you lower on the right side of the bolt line.

content.description: Start on right side of giant flake. Move to top of flake. Next move up and right following line of least resistance. At chossy rock move left to last bolt of Die fledermaus. Fun route with big moves on big holds.
content.location: Uphill from Die Fledermaus at a tree and flake.

content.description: Start on flake below and left of first bolt. Lieback up corner thru 2 bolts. Next move right to rail just below 3rd bolt. Move up to good hands and bolt and then traverse right to anchors on "Crack-a-lackin"

Scramble up to initial large ledge left of tree. Walk right to first bolt.   Climb fins and flakes clipping next bolt.    Minimize using the manky corner, 

  in fact avoid the chossy bits all together,  

  and climb left on crimps and sides pulls (crux) over next bolt arriving at another large ledge.   From here move back into corner(not manky). Climb remaining bolts to top.

Start in the same dihedral as Biohazard, but move up and right onto arete. Cross right on slab to a bolt and gain a large ledge. From here continue straight up the route staying very close to the bolt line. Around bolt number 10 you will see Biohazard's anchor to the left (don't clip it). From here climb up and right unto naturally exposed rock passing 4 more bolts to anchors at the very top of the cliff.
Climb arete
content.location: Right of die fledermaus about 25' high on a ledge

content.description: Climb right to left rising crack until the end then move up on top of the nose to a bolted anchor
content.protection: 1 bolt and gear to 5". 2 bolt anchor at top of rock
content.location: From the top of Kurz anchor walk right around a corner on a big ledge. Start in little left facing corner. 1 bolt(?) and gear for anchor.

content.description: Start in the corner of Jungle Book moving up until you can undercling right to a high bolt. Pass bolt using the arete. then up a bit more (spicy) until you can move left to a stance. Place some gear then up tiny crack to another stance and set small wires, rps, etc. Climb up a move or 2 then go left to Jungle Book anchors.
content.protection: 1 Bolt, gear from tiny thru 1" and shared anchors with Jungle Book
content.location: Start in the corner of Jungle Book

content.description: Climb stemming dihedral with some crack moves and/or lay backing to anchors.   A fun little climb easily TRed.
content.protection: If TRing, TR is set from climbing part 1 of Swinging Singles and moving right on ledge to Jungle Book Anchors..

content.description: weem-awop-a-weem-awop...Start on north side of 7 Slates buttress just left of tree.Climb steep corner with finger crack in roof (crux) to first bolt. Overcome temptation to use the trees at the start. Then a committing mantle above 2nd bolt to slab. Climb slab to small roof. Continue up thin face (5.9) with many balance moves (i.e. use you feet!) and lay back the upper arete to anchors.
content.protection: The most over bolted route at north.   11 bolts plus 2 bolt anchor.   May need a couple "alpine" style draws to extend (or back clean) bolts 1 and 5.

content.description: climb steep face to double crack. Climb right when able. Finish on right most crack to anchors
Climb left facing upside-down staircase

This route may be used to access the balcony rock routes.Start left of first high bolt and follow easy ramp up and right. Climb passing a bulge and then lower angle ledges. At Last bolt move left to anchors.From the anchor one may move left to another set of anchors. Then up to top of cliff  to trees and walk over to balcony rock climbs.
content.protection:
7-8 bolts and bolted anchor.

 A lower set of anchors have been installed to mitigate the chossy top traverse and is now a better stand alone route

content.description: Named after a bat (fledermaus) that was disturbed in removing a large loose flake.   This climb has a few interesting features, plus even though there are lotsa bolts it still seems spooky to me the whole time.   Start around the corner and right of "7 Slates of gray".   If you are not comfortable with chimneying you might want to stick clip the first high bolt.   Climb chimney to its top. Climb up over the bulging face(crux). Follow flakes and small stances on near vertical terrain to about the 9th bolt. Next, climb up and right for 2 or 3 more bolts to anchors under a large pine tree (90').   There is an optional trad/solo second pitch to trees (5.5 R/X)   Walk off Right(south)
content.protection:
13 bolts plus 2 bolt anchor 

  Stick Clip helpful if your are uncomfortable in chimneys for the first bolt!

content.description: Start on Chossy rock for a move or two until you reach the better rock with finger crack. Follow crack up and slightly right to a small tree then move left to crack-a-lackin anchors.
content.location: Just right of Bee Line. Finger crack starts about 8' off the ground.

content.description: Struggle to gain a stance right off the ground. Stem, chimney and jam up the    crack, which goes from hands to fingers to closed and then hands again. Pretty good variety of moves for such a short climb.
content.protection:
3 bolts or   trad to 2", passive works best.

 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: 20' right of predator in a large dihedral

content.description: Chimney,stem and squeeze the chimney just north of 1.5 mile marker.   Is the route horrifying or horrible?
This route is about 50 feet south (climbers right) of Chimney of Horror. Scramble up inside corner to high bolt. Climb steep face on crimps and side pulls following bolts to anchors.

Start on the middle of 7 Slates buttress just right of a tree. The first bolt can easily be clipped from tree protecting difficult moves off the ground (but that would only count as pink point, wouldn't it. haha!). Climb steep right leaning crack to triangular alcove. It is fairly pumpy clipping the 3rd bolt. Perform powerful moves up and right on terrible ring locks to where the crack widens. In the back of the crack are great finger jams to clip the 4th bolt. From here move up and left to gain a rest and the next bolt. Beat the pump clock and fire the rest of the route at about 5.9+ on steep terrain with big holds that are sometimes far apart.

 There is a lot of climbing in 50 feet on this one. Enjoy! Recently some holds have broken/shifted decreasing the difficulty to about 11c. It is still a fun route, so get on it!
content.protection:
7-8 bolts plus 2 bolt anchor 

  TR can be gained by climbing "in the jungle" then rapping down to anchors

content.description: Lie back sharp corner to top move left to Crack-a-lackin and 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection:
TR off Crack-a-lacky anchors 

  There is 1 bolt high up used for directional when TRing.

content.description: Start at a steep face with interesting pinches. After the second bolt the rock on the right is friable. I managed to climb this section without really using it though. Climb the upper section by lying back the corner to a jug at the top.
A Crack in the woods just before 1.5 on a pillar

This route starts on a boulder under a blunt corner.   Finger jam up short crack (about 3 or 4 moves) that angles up and right to the corner (crux).   Swing around corner on thin face to more bolts with a lot of climbing.   Follow bolts and line of least resistance with good route finding skills to the anchors. There are some remaining loose chips up there.
content.location: Right/south side of steep face 30' right of Bernie plays base with 15' angling finger crack at the 1.55 mile marker.   Start on top of a boulder

content.description: Enter a description of this area.
